text: weekend sports okay hello my needle
drops Anthony Fantan oh here internets
busiest music nerd gonna do an album
review fresh off my nerd track review
yesterday and now that I got a track
review in me I'm pumped Pumped to talk
about a full-length LP yeah I'm ready
I'm ready I'm tough what's up I can take
it okay forget it sorry let's be serious
because music is serious business Before
we jump into this one thing I want to
mention on the needle drop calm you can
stream the new caribou remix album
stream a new song from the new deer of
LP coming out next year and you can see
the blog TV playlist from the blog TV we
had this past Monday it's all linked
there in the d'box so anyways speaking
about being tough this album is tough oh
yeah it's tough it's not like Henry
Rollins tough it's more like getting a
ton of bricks dropped on you tough their
new signee to the slumberland records
label their name is weekend and this is
their album sports these guys are a
California trio whose music I could
really only classify as as noise rock
but like I said earlier these guys are
on slumberland and slumberland has
housed some of the serious powerhouses
of shoegaze like black tambourine and
some new favorites like the pains of
being pure at heart or crystal stilts so
there's definitely an element of that
classic shoegaze II slumberland sound in
there too this thing is 10 tracks spans
45 minutes and I'll get my number one
gripe out of the way right now there are
several tracks on here that are either
filler or are kind of bordering on
filler not much happens it kind of
meanders may be boring but the tracks
that i do like are much longer it
doesn't feel like the album gets
derailed I don't feel cheated I don't
feel gypped maybe these tracks are more
transition periods the songs that do
excite me though on this album are
hard-hitting pieces of noise punk
psychedelic Adelia punk because the
drums are so fast the bass lines are
pumping the tempos are high this thing
just has a really hot energy it is a pot
boiling over it is a car about to
overheat it is a plane with a blown
engine it is that kind of tension and I
say psychedelic because this thing is
soaked in reverb the vocals the guitars
I think the drums to nearly everything
it just is this wash of sound however
even though a lot of bands are pursuing
this sound a lot of bands are doing the
reverb thing what I like about the
reverb in this particular instance is
that it doesn't take away from the
brutality of the songs it doesn't take
away from the percussion it doesn't take
away from just how energized the music
feels because usually a lot of the
shoegaze these stuff a lot of this
cavernous production has the tendency to
be sleepy and though there are some
moments on here like that maybe noise
ambient tracks I guess you could say the
parts on here that are upbeat that our
fast-paced come together really well I
wouldn't say the production here creates
a dreamscape as much as a whirlwind of
pain and the final thing is is just the
noise which maybe is this albums biggest
strength the guitar sounds here gets so
ugly and gets so distorted I mean just
take the opener for example coma summer
you can stream that one in the in the
d'box the tone on the guitar is there
man it sounds like somebody's trying to
open my skull with a giant electric can
opener distorted guitar layered over
distorted guitar and on this track and a
bunch of songs on this album a lot of
weird atmosfera comes that I really
couldn't even begin to describe is it
feedback is that some kind of effect is
it electronics i'm not sure but it's
there I love the production and not to
say the sound here is
crystal clear or comes off as if it was
recorded in a
one-hundred-thousand-dollar in our
studio Sports is just loud aggressive
proud not catchy but haunting because
they don't really find myself humming
along with melodies or mouthing lyrics
when I'm finished listening to this
album as much as I am just kind of
sitting back and admiring the dent
weekend has put in my eardrums this
thing just barely squeaked by with a
light 8 i'm going to put it on the love
list which is linked down there in the
d'box a list of albums that i loved thus
far this year and let me know in the
comments what you think I should review
next album reviews track reviews
whatever reviews thanks for requesting
this thanks for being awesome Anthony
Fantana weekend sports forever
click the like button for justice
